content:
Please fix the issues:
* https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-key-value-store-puzzle-discussion/206746/2
* Delete all trailing newlines in the output of all cases.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approve this contribution because it correctly implements a key-value store with support for setting, updating, retrieving, checking existence, and listing keys in insertion order, meeting all problem requirements efficiently.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great puzzle for beginners, may be enhanced in a second version to be submitted in medium difficulty (add a type system maybe ?).

*Output should be space-separated for GET, EXISTS and KEYS.*

I find this sentence a bit confusing without a proper example. However, tests provided are pretty clear about the expected output so I guess that's OK.
Like Dean : easy but fun!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy but fun!

Thanks for the feedback!
I've made the required changes as requested
Please let me know if anything else if needed
thanks! I removed the Redis part, fixed typos, clarified key updates, and added all the details you mentioned. Test cases are also updated. Let me know if anything else is needed!

Title / Cover picture / Goal
* The mention of "Redis" and "in-memory" in the problem statement isn’t necessary, as the task focuses purely on implementing basic key–value store behaviour without involving persistence, performance, or Redis-specific features. These terms might mislead solvers into thinking they need to replicate Redis internals or optimise for memory. Instead, consider framing the task simply as implementing a basic key–value store that supports a few commands. This keeps the focus on the functional requirements and avoids unnecessary assumptions.

Goal
* Please change "No thing" to "Nothing".

* Please mention what happens when the same key is set more than once.

* Please format "null", "true" and "false" as a {{constants}}.

* For the "KEY" command:
  • Please mention the order keys should be printed.
  • Please mention what should be printed when no keys have been set.

* Please mention that the output should be space-separated for <<GET>>, <<EXISTS>> and <<KEYS>>.

Input
* Please format "N" (in "Next N lines") as a [[variable]].

* Please format "Line 1" and "Next N lines" in <<bold>>.

Constraints
* "[[Keys]]" and "[[Values]]" are not defined anywhere. Please change "[[Keys]] and [[Values]]" to "Keys and values in [[S]]".

* Please add "or {{=}}" after "spaces".

* Please swap the order of the two constraints.

Cases
* Please add cases to feature the EXISTS instruction.

* Please add comprehensive cases where the following all happen in a single case:
  • SET to assign multiple keys, including:
      - keys that are equal to their values and keys that are not
      - duplicate keys in the same command
  • GET to request both existing and non-existent keys, in a different order from how they were set
  • KEYS
  • EXISTS to check both existing and non-existent keys, again in varied order
  • More SET, including:
      - Some for new keys, some overwriting existing keys (including those that originally were equal to their values)
      - duplicate keys in the same command
  • GET again, the same as last time
  • KEYS again
  • EXISTS again, the same as last time

Thanks.

Thank you for revising the puzzle. Please find my suggestions on the current version:

Goal
* Please change "it already" to "the key already" for clarity.

* Please change "entered" to "first set" for clarity.

Input
* Please change "Line 1" to "<<Line 1>>".

* Please change "Next N lines" to "<<Next [[N]] lines>>".

Cases
* codin-game (test):
  • Please change N to 12, add an "EXISTS" instruction, and modify the output accordingly.

* codin-game (validator):
  • Same change as codin-game (test).

* All (test)
  • Please change N to 17, add "KEYS" at the beginning of the input, and add "EMPTY" at the beginning of the output.
  • Please shuffle the order of the parameters of *all* GET and EXISTS instructions, e.g. "GETS a b c d e" becomes "GETS e a c b d".
  • For both "GETS" and "EXISTS", add some values as parameters, e.g. "GETS t u v w m" becomes "GETS v w universe tree u t".

* All (validator)
  • Same three changes as All (test).

Thanks.
Thank you for pointing that out! I've corrected the issue
